message: What steps should I take when learning a new language?

data.message:
You need to learn Object oriented because it's common in any language in the world. then learn the syntax of this language and as Ahmed Commented you will need to practice a lot.

I've seen some people who make a repo and make an app a day with the language they are learning. https://www.openshift.com/blogs/day-15-meteor-building-a-web-app-from-scratch-in-meteor

Well, I don't know if I know enough of the language to be writing apps :/
I think I am somewhat familiar with object oriented having used javascript a bit, but I want to learn Ruby now so...you know
I'm currently taking the course at treehouse, but I feel it's telling you how to do something with Ruby instead of telling you how to use Ruby
Well this is how you learn the language! by doing something. or you are looking for academic studies?
Nope, well...I don't know, are you sure their way is effective?

Yes, I'm Sure because this is how I learned ruby by doing real (live) apps. and this is how you learn any other language by doing stuff and  building cool apps. i think reading a book is not as efficient as practicing by hand.

Ok, great...may be I'm just anxious about wanting to get to coding like a pro fast that I question what I'm doing constantly :/
Thank you for the support :)
there is no anxious in programing you wanna get things done do it by hand. unfortunately universities make us more academic and not apply stuff in programming it's different. Good luck.
